intro: Carduus chius, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges and a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Carduus chius is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, where it thrives in full sun.
